scenario:
Wall Street's Q4 earnings season begins next week with notable names such as JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, Citigroup, BlackRock, Bank of America, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, UnitedHealth, and Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing reporting their financial results. The following week sees high-profile names like Netflix, American Express, Johnson & Johnson, Procter & Gamble, GE Aerospace, American Airlines, United Airlines, and Verizon report earnings. The mega-cap tech companies, including Microsoft, Alphabet, Tesla, Meta Platforms, Amazon, and Apple, are scheduled to release their quarterly updates in the final week of January.

Analysts expect annualized profit growth of +11.9% and an increase of +4.6% in revenue growth. The Financial sector is expected to report the largest annualized earnings growth rate of all eleven sectors, at +39.5%. The sector includes high-profile companies such as JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Citigroup, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, Visa, Mastercard, and American Express.

The Information Technology sector is forecast to come in second, with +20.7% year-over-year EPS growth. The sector includes tech giants such as Apple, Nvidia, Microsoft, Broadcom, Salesforce, Oracle, Cisco, ServiceNow, and IBM.

In contrast, earnings from the Energy sector are expected to tumble -24.6% compared to last year - the worst drop of any sector by far. The sector includes oil and gas giants such as ExxonMobil, Chevron, ConocoPhillips, EOG Resources, Schlumberger, and Kinder Morgan.

UnitedHealth is one of the notable names in the Q4 earnings season. The company is expected to report its financial results next week.
